multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing hair loss for about 2 months, noticing clumps of hair coming out especially in the shower and on my pillow.
Is there any associated itching or irritation on your scalp?
No, I don't have any scalp itch or irritation.
Have you noticed any changes in your texture or appearance of your nails recently?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in the texture or appearance of my nails.
Have you recently gone through a major stressful event or change in your life around the time the hair loss started?
Yes, about 8 months ago, I was involved in a motor vehicle accident which resulted in several fractures and a difficult recovery.
Have you started any new medications following the accident or for any other condition recently?
Yes, I have been taking ibuprofen for my pain since the beginning of my recovery, which started about 8 months ago.
Do any of your family members have a history of hair loss or autoimmune diseases?
I haven't mentioned any family history of hair loss or autoimmune diseases.
Final Diagnosis: Telogen Effluvium
